meanings.sent1: The coordinative efforts of the team led to a successful project completion.
meanings.sent2: The coordinative role of the conductor ensured that the orchestra played in harmony.
meanings.sent3: The coordinative dance moves of the penguins entertained the zoo visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her coordinative skills were like a conductor orchestrating a beautiful symphony.
meanings.sent5: The coordinative nature of the traffic lights kept the flow of cars smooth and efficient.

meanings.sent1: The coordinative project required input from all team members to succeed.
meanings.sent2: The coordinative effort between departments improved overall efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The coordinative picnic planning made sure everyone had their favorite food.
meanings.sent4: Their coordinative teamwork was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The coordinative spirit of the community event brought everyone together for a common goal.

meanings.definition: Skilled in coordinating movements or actions
meanings.sent1: The coordinative gymnast executed her routine flawlessly.
meanings.sent2: The coordinative quarterback directed his team with precision on the field.
meanings.sent3: The coordinative chef effortlessly managed multiple dishes cooking at once.
meanings.sent4: His coordinative abilities in juggling tasks amazed his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The coordinative dancer moved gracefully across the stage, captivating the audience.
